He plans to move court soon, citing his poor mental health and her alleged indifference.

title: UK study finds ctDNA blood test can predict treatment response in advanced breast cancer
description: Breast cancer is a growing concern in India, with early detection crucial for survival.  New research from London offers hope: a blood test detecting circulating tumor DNA (ctDNA) can predict treatment response in advanced cases. While promising, ctDNA is a risk factor, not a definitive cure predictor, and doesn't replace traditional biopsies for initial diagnosis.

Addressing gender bias in engineering
description: To understand the participation of women in the engineering sector and ways to improve it, The Hindu hosted a webinar titled, ‘Addressing gender bias in engineering’, on January 17 at 5:00 p.m. The panellists included Sobhitha Neelanath, Senior Manager, Software Engineering, Salesforce India; Prof. Poonam Kumar, Professor, Dept. of Mechanical Engineering, IIT Guwahati; Dean, Faculty of Engineering & Technology, Director, K J Somaiya College of Engineering,Somaiya Vidyavihar University. The webinar was moderated by Ravina Warkad, Senior Sub-Editor at the Education Vertical of The Hindu.

title: Air pollution linked to high BP in children: Doctor explains
description: New research reveals a concerning link between PM2.5 air pollution and elevated blood pressure in children aged 5-12. Studies indicate that prenatal and postnatal exposure to these fine particles can increase blood pressure percentiles and the risk of hypertension. Experts emphasize that reducing exposure early may offer potential for reversibility.

Tom Brady grows wary of past mistakes with Alix Earle amid romance rumors
description: Tom Brady and popular influencer, Alix Earle, turned heads with their romance at the New Year’s Eve party in St. Barth’s. The two were spotted standing close to each other as Alix Earle rubbed Tom Brady’s back. This has sparked chaos among fans as many are excited about their future. But it seems the NFL legend might be “suspicious” of Alix Earle.

title: 'I chose it out of passion': Google founder Sergey Brin on studying computer science
description: Google co-founder Sergey Brin recently shared insights on the evolving value of higher education in the age of AI. He emphasized that passion and curiosity, rather than just credentials, drive success, even as AI capabilities grow. Brin also noted Google's shift towards hiring "self-taught stars" with proven skills over solely relying on traditional degrees.

title: Jeff Bezos’ ex-wife's donations questioned - What it revealed?
description: MacKenzie Scott's ex-wife, Jeff Bezos, has donated millions to the Solidaire Network, which funds groups facing FBI and congressional investigations for alleged Hamas ties. While Scott's donations are unrestricted, the network supports organizations like Students for Justice in Palestine. Scott has given billions to various causes, impacting diversity programs and higher education.

title: Roger Federer revisits Australian Open glory with wife Mirka and kids
description: Roger Federer returned to the 2026 Australian Open with his full family and shared emotional memories from Melbourne. The seven-time champion spoke about reliving past wins, watching old clips, and his children playing with his trophy. Federer also played an exhibition match, giving fans another special moment from the tennis legend.

title: Bill Belichick ESPN Role; UNC Post 4-8" (39 chars). Cuts fluff, retains facts
description: Bill Belichick will appear on ESPN’s ACC Network broadcast of the College Football Playoff national championship game in South Florida. The TV role comes weeks after his first season as North Carolina’s head coach ended at 4–8. Belichick is also focused on recruiting, including adding quarterback Billy Edwards Jr. ahead of the Tar Heels’ April 12 spring game.
